intro: Psephellus aucherianus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Psephellus aucherianus is also known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and is often cultivated for its vibrant, long-lasting blooms.
